meanings.sent1: The teacher will annunciate the winner of the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: She always annunciates the daily specials at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to annunciate the word 'hello' but it came out as 'hillo'.
meanings.sent4: The church bells annunciate the arrival of the new year.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker annunciated the emergency evacuation instructions clearly.

meanings.sent1: The mayor will annunciate the new city ordinance tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: They annunciated their engagement to friends and family.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to annunciate its hunger by knocking over its food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm annunciated its arrival with dark clouds and strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The breaking news annunciated a major development in the ongoing investigation.

meanings.sent1: Please annunciate your words clearly so everyone can understand you.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to annunciate the foreign name correctly.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to annunciate the complicated scientific terms but ended up garbling them.
meanings.sent4: The singer annunciated each note with precision and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The actor annunciated his lines flawlessly during the performance.
